data.title: Wizz Wazz
data.statement:
Let's play a game of <<Wizz Wazz>>!

[[N]] players <<form a circle>> and pass an <<imaginary ball>>.
The ball can only pass from a player to one of their neighbours. 
When a player receives the ball, they say {{Wizz}} to pass the ball to their other neighbour, or {{Wazz}} to give it back.
The first player gives the ball to their right neighbour by saying {{Wizz right}} or to their left neighbour by saying {{Wizz left}}.

Your goal is to output the index of the player who has the ball at the end of the game. The [[N]] players are <<0-indexed>>, players go from left to right in <<increasing indexes>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Let's play a game of Wizz Wazz!

N players form a circle and pass an imaginary ball.
The ball can only pass from a player to one of their neighbours.
When a player receives the ball, they say Wizz to pass the ball to their other neighbour, or Wazz to give it back.
The first player gives the ball to their right neighbour by saying Wizz right or to their left neighbour by saying Wizz left.

Your goal is to output the index of the player who has the ball at the end of the game. The N players are 0-indexed, players go from left to right in increasing indexes.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of players.
Line 2: An integer firstPlayer for the index of the first player.
Line 3: An integer turns for the number of turns before the game ends.
Next turns lines: A string turn describing the turn.
Output
A single integer representing the index of the player who currently has the ball.
Constraints
Example
Input
6
1
3
Wizz right
Wizz
Wazz
Output
2
